column4: so I try to download the sun jre and I get an error saying I am missing the .bin files from the repositories
so I try to download the sun jre and I get an error saying I am missing the .bin files from the repositories
so I try to download the sun jre and I get an error saying I am missing the .bin files from the repositories
warbo I went to the java page
Don't install the sun-java5-doc package, since that needs some extra setting up
What I am saying is, install the package sun-java5-bin, but not the sun-java5-doc, unless you want to go through a little bit of extra work, just to get the documentation
Then do what I originally said, and install sun-java5-bin
If it went through "setting up sun-java5-bin" and stuff then yes
Can you paste the single line from "sudo dpkg -l | grep java5-bin" please
OK, can you pastebin the file /etc/apt/sources.list, cos it looks like you might not have multiverse

That's weird. The only thing I can think of is that ie.archive.ubuntu.com might not have the right package. Try running "gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list" then adding a line "deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ dapper main restricted universe multiverse", saving, updating Apt, then trying again
Go into Syanptic and install sun-java5-bin from there, it is easier :)
I am really wondering why they are not installable. Your sources look fine
Are you running Edgy by any chance?
Your sources are for Dapper. If you don't know what edgy is then you are probably not running it
